abstract: For telephone users, AT&Ts latest talk with investors had mixed news: it is building a new high speed wireless network. But its profit margins are growing, as lower competition reduces pressure to keep prices low.
snippet: For telephone users, AT&Ts latest talk with investors had mixed news: it is building a new high speed wireless network. But its profit margins are growing, as lower competition reduces pressure to keep prices low.
lead_paragraph: AT&T is doing fine. It is firing enough employees and selling enough wireless subscriptions to make up for the sharp decline in the number of old-fashioned telephone wires its customers pay for.

headline.main: The Network That AT&T’s Growing Profits Will Buy
